alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Herkimer; Montgomery (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 11:46AM EST until February 19 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Fulton County in eastern New York... Southeastern Herkimer County in eastern New York... Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 1230 PM EST. * At 1146 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Caroga Lake to near Cherry Valley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29. Locations impacted include... Amsterdam, Gloversville, Johnstown, Canajoharie, Fonda, Fort Plain, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Broadalbin, Hagaman, Mayfield, Fort Johnson, Ames, Caroga Lake, Tribes Hill, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Perth, Glen, Oppenheim and Berkshire. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
